text: hey guys it's angel today at Tuesday and
I'm super excited to be kicking off my
new video series called tip Tuesday's
where every Tuesday I'm gonna be sharing
with you some of my favorite kitchen and
home tips and tricks now this is in
addition to the video recipes they
already share with you guys so don't
worry we will always have those I really
hope that you guys find these kitchen
tips and tricks helpful so with that
let's get started with our first tip
Tuesday so today's tip is on how to make
your store-bought salad mixes last
longer so if you guys ever go to the
store and buy pre-washed baby spinach or
a mixed greens or even kale or romaine
it usually comes in like a plastic
baggie or a plastic clamshell container
like this and with this tip I can
usually extend the life of my salad
mixes by one to two weeks beyond the
sell-by date now I know it sounds a
little gross but this trick really does
work all you need is half a sheet of a
paper towel so what I usually do is when
I come home before I pop it into the
fridge first open it up check to see if
there are any wilted leaves if there are
any wilted leaves or ones that look
really sad do
and take them out this batch looks fine
here so what I'm just gonna do is put my
paper towel put it right on top of the
salad mix cover it up flip it over give
it a good shake and store it in the
fridge now the paper towel works by
drawing away any excess moisture away
from the lead keeping your salad mix
fresh and crisp and therefore extending
your salad life about one to two weeks I
hope you guys enjoyed today's kitchen
tip don't forget to join me next week
for another tip Tuesday and stay tuned
because I will be doing my kitchen tour
shortly I will see you guys soon bye
